column2: formerly known as Ütersen (Holstein)) is a city in the district of Pinneberg
column4: Germany. It is situated approximately 7 km (4.3 mi) south of Elmshorn
column5: and 30 km (19 mi) northwest of Hamburg at the small Pinnau River
column6: close to the Elbe river. Uetersen is home to the Rosarium Uetersen
column7: the oldest and largest rose garden in Northern Germany

column1: The name of the city Uetersen
column3: probably arose because it is "at the extreme end"
column4: referring to the fact that its location is at the transition to the geest Seestermüher marsh. But there is also the suspicion that the name of "Ütersteen" showing what "ultra-stone" or "Ütristina"
column5: the old name of Pinnau originates.

column1: Blazon:In a red shield is a silver (= white) gate without any door. The wall has six pinnacles. There is a silver (= white) tower on each side
column2: having two windows each and topped by silver (= white) triangular roofs. Between the towers there is the nettle-leaf of the Counts of Holstein. In the open door at the base there stands a silver (= white) S-shaped object
column3: which might show Virgin Mary and Jesus
column4: standing upon a golden (= yellow) lying moon crescent and flanked by two golden (= yellow) stars on a red background. Below the door is a blue field probably symbolizing water.

column1: A list of people who were born in Uetersen
column2: live or have lived and work in the town or have been involved with it.
penfriend of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

column3: inherited the 27 hectare site of the  Langenmühle to the city of Uetersen

column2: footballer of the national team of 1957

column1: === More people who are closely linked to Uetersen ===
These people have lived in Uetersen or are closely linked to the town. They have contributed to the reputation of the town or to the general welfare of the population.
